actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that a woman divorced from an insured individual may qualify for wife's or widow's insurance benefits on such individual's wage record if she had been married to him for a total of 20 years, whether or not such years were consecutive.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends Title II (Old Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide that a woman divorced from an insured individual may qualify for wife's or widow's insurance benefits on such individual's wage record if she had been married to him for a total of 20 years, whether or not such years were consecutive.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that a woman divorced from an insured individual may qualify for wife's or widow's insurance benefits on such individual's wage record if she had been married to him for a total of 20 years, whether or not such years were consecutive.
